entry.title: You're All I Have
entry.summary:
Author: addywrites

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,000Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 758

Summary: After the arbitration hearing, Buck gets a phone call he never expected to get. Abby had died leaving behind a son, his son. Buck now facing the challenges of fatherhood has to figure out how to do it on his own without the 118 backing him. Can he get his family back? Can he get his job back without burning it all to the ground? Can he do all this while trying to be the best father he can be for his son.

entry.title: Buckley's Chance
entry.summary:
Author: RaspberryDreams1

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 56,094Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 463

Summary: Evan knows that wish babies are extremely rare, the Fae only grant a handful of wishes per year and almost never to single parents. But Evan so desperately wants a family to love that he’s been subconsciously wishing since he was a teenager. Eddie hadn’t thought of wishing for a baby, he had barely heard of wish babies or soulmates, his parents didn’t believe in such things. Eddie desperately wanted a place for him and his son to belong, a family that would accept him without demanding that he change who he was to fit their impossibly unrealistic expectations.

entry.title: riding to the sea
entry.summary:
Author: banksoflochlomond

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,271Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 30

Summary: The idea comes to him on one of his drives through the mountains. He’s driving up, and up, and up until the road has a steep, sheer drop on one side, and nobody’s driving alongside him. He’s headed to the top of a mountain. There’s a gravel pull-off right before a hairpin turn. The turn is protected by a flimsy guardrail.  Eddie parks on the pull-off and walks over to look past the guardrail. Nothing underneath. Just dry underbrush. A shallow stream right at the bottom. Thin vegetation. If a car missed the curve at a fair speed, it would plummet down the cliff. Next to no chance of survival. And Eddie’s known to drive, to clear his own head. He used to do it to find hiking trails for him and Buck, or roadside attractions or activities that Christopher might like. It’s a known hobby of his. He’s a good driver. So it’s not convincing if he crashes in good weather. He’ll have to wait for a storm. But it’ll work. It has to work.   (Or: Eddie and all the ways you shouldn't love your loved ones.)

entry.title: dreaming again. dreaming of him.
entry.summary:
Author: mythmagicetc

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,660Chapters: 3/4Kudos: 256

Summary: Eddie knew it was his own damn fault, since he'd waved off the apologies when Buck recognized the barely-awake fogginess of his voice. He did want to talk to him, always would, but, well. There was no excuse for the way it slipped out of his mouth.“I was dreaming about you.”Buck giggled. “Were you?” he said teasingly. “Were we on a pirate ship? Or exploring a rainforest? Building a time machine?” And it was sweet, and silly, and at least Buck felt the warmth in his voice and didn’t assume Eddie meant a nightmare. Because, fuck. It was not a nightmare.____or: In El Paso, Eddie keeps having sex dreams about Buck, and Buck knows about them. Well, kind of.

entry.title: Even the Dead Still Breathe
entry.summary:
Author: BlckOnyx

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 104,402Chapters: 26/26Kudos: 124

Summary: It has been a year since Bobby’s death, and Buck has never been the same. Grief eats at him in quiet ways the rest of the 118 can’t quite reach, so when he announces he’s taking a break and heading abroad, everyone tells themselves he deserves the space. A week later, he disappears. Weeks turn into months, and the people he left behind are forced to believe the unthinkable—that Buck walked away for good. Until the headlines change, and the word “presumed dead” settles over them like ash. What none of them know is that Buck’s story didn’t end there. His grief, his secrets, and the dangerous truth he’s been carrying all lead back to a past no one at the 118 ever imagined. And when the pieces finally surface, the loss they thought they understood becomes something else entirely. How will the 118 deal with losing people they love, only to find out later that it was all a lie? OR Buck disappeared, and the truth might destroy what’s left of the family they built.

entry.title: you could be my baby, baby, baby
entry.summary:
Author: Elgney

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,288Chapters: 6/10Kudos: 560

Summary: “My mom said, uh, that his name was Buck. That he was going to go to the fire academy and that he had a—” she broke off, rubbing her own forehead, exactly where his skin went pink. “She said he went by Firehose.” Buck didn’t need all of his coworkers to look at him in alarm; he was pretty sure he’d gone deadly pale. His daughter knew four things about him, and one of them was his old tinder profile handle. He felt a little like he was going to die. “She’s got your eyes,” Eddie commented, unhelpfully. ---- Buck finds out he has a daughter, and also a stupidly big crush on his best friend. It's an adjustment.

entry.title: Blink
entry.summary:
Author: Sayohwell

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 80,862Chapters: 28/?Kudos: 971

Summary: After suing Bobby to come back to work, it isn't really the warm welcome back Buck had been hoping for. He's solidly on the outside of the 118 family now; it hurts less, thanks to this, when Buck has to leave again for a deployment. Buck comes back hurt, quiet, and tries to live again with everything that's happened to him on his deployment.
